metadata.title: CVE-2020-25629 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: A vulnerability was found in Moodle where users with "Log in as" capabilityin a course context (typically, course managers) may gain access to somesite administration capabilities by "logging in as" a System manager. Thisaffects 3.9 to 3.9.1, 3.8 to 3.8.4, 3.7 to 3.7.7, 3.5 to 3.5.13 and earlierunsupported versions. This is fixed in 3.9.2, 3.8.5, 3.7.8 and 3.5.14.

criterions.comment: moodle: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
